author: pipermerriam
content: <@!643137323831132186> I don't think this server is the right place to get this type of help.  Try the Ethereum stack exchange?  This server is for protocol development and research.

author: ann_kane
content: Okay, <@364458974906548225>, sorry about that.  Did you delete my message?  It would be nice if I could copy it.  I don't have a copy of it.  Can you private post it to me?  Thank you.

author: pipermerriam
content: For those of you who have been part of the "Stateless Ethereum" effort and those of you watching on, I'm going to be making a case to sort of "invert" our approach.  I wrote up a version of what I'm proposing in a forum post here: https://ethresear.ch/t/complete-revamp-of-the-stateless-ethereum-roadmap/8592

author: pietjepuk
content:
(Part of the "watching on" crowd.)

Great post! Can't contribute much except for a proofread:

First sentence
> use witnesses to to execute and verify new blocks 
"to to" -> "to"

And more importantly in the summary:
> We need new client teams that are dedicated to build stateless clients since we **should** expect current client teams to do this.
"should" -> "shouldn't"
